diseases.description: Diabetes is a chronic medical condition where the body either does not produce enough insulin or cannot effectively use the insulin it produces. This leads to elevated blood glucose levels. Proper management through medication, lifestyle changes, and diet is crucial.
diseases.recoveryTime: Ongoing management
diseases.costEstimate: $100-$200 per month

diseases.description: Hypertension, also known as high blood pressure, is a chronic medical condition where the blood pressure in the arteries is persistently elevated. It can lead to serious health complications if not managed properly. Common causes include lifestyle factors, genetics, and other underlying health conditions.
diseases.recoveryTime: Management is ongoing, often requiring lifelong treatment and lifestyle adjustments
diseases.costEstimate: $50-$100 per month

diseases.description: Asthma is a chronic respiratory condition characterized by inflammation and narrowing of the airways, leading to difficulty breathing. It is often triggered by allergens, respiratory infections, or environmental factors. Symptoms can vary in severity and may be managed with medication and lifestyle changes.
diseases.recoveryTime: Manageable with medication and lifestyle adjustments
diseases.costEstimate: Approximately INR 10,000 to 20,000 per year, depending on severity and treatment plan

diseases.description: Influenza, commonly known as the flu, is a viral infection affecting the respiratory system. It is characterized by sudden onset of fever, chills, muscle aches, and respiratory symptoms. Influenza can lead to complications, especially in vulnerable populations such as the elderly, young children, and those with weakened immune systems.
preventionTips: Avoid close contact with sick individuals
diseases.recoveryTime: Typically 1-2 weeks with proper rest and treatment
diseases.costEstimate: Varies based on location and treatment, generally ₹3,000-₹15,000 for consultation and medication

diseases.description: Migraine is a neurological condition characterized by severe, recurring headaches that can cause nausea, vomiting, and heightened sensitivity to light and sound. Migraines can significantly impact daily activities and quality of life. Treatment often involves managing symptoms and preventing future attacks.
diseases.recoveryTime: Varies; migraines usually last from a few hours to a day, with recovery time depending on treatment and individual response
diseases.costEstimate: ₹500-₹2,000 per prescription for medication

diseases.description: Ringworm is a common fungal infection that affects the skin, scalp, and nails. Despite its name, ringworm is not caused by a worm but by a group of fungi known as dermatophytes. Here is a detailed description:
symptoms: Hair loss in the affected area
diet: Maintain a healthy and balanced diet
treatment: Keep the affected area clean and dry
Avoid sharing personal items like towels or clothing
exercise: No excersice is needed , Maintain a hygine lifestyle
diseases.recoveryTime: 2 to 4 weeks with proper treatment
diseases.costEstimate: INR 200 - INR 500 for topical treatments

diseases.description: Malaria is a serious and potentially life-threatening infectious disease caused by parasites of the genus Plasmodium, which are transmitted to humans through the bites of infected female Anopheles mosquitoes.
diseases.recoveryTime: 1 to 2 weeks with treatment
diseases.costEstimate: INR 1,000 to 5,000 for treatment

diseases.description: Cancer is a group of diseases characterized by uncontrolled cell growth that can invade or spread to other parts of the body.
preventionTips: Eat a diet rich in fruits and vegetables
diseases.recoveryTime: Varies based on type and stage
diseases.costEstimate: INR 1,00,000 - 10,00,000 depending on treatment

diseases.description: Breast cancer is a type of cancer that forms in the cells of the breasts, often detected through lumps or changes in breast tissue.
symptoms: Changes in breast shape or size
Redness or flaky skin on breast
diseases.recoveryTime: Varies based on stage and treatment
diseases.costEstimate: INR 2,00,000 - 7,00,000 depending on treatment

diseases.description: Lung cancer is a type of cancer that begins in the lungs. It often develops in smokers but can occur in non-smokers as well. Early detection is challenging but crucial for effective treatment.
diseases.recoveryTime: Varies by stage; requires ongoing management and follow-ups
diseases.costEstimate: $2000-$5000 per month depending on treatment type and stage

diseases.description: Throat cancer refers to cancers that develop in the throat (pharynx) or voice box (larynx). It may be associated with smoking and excessive alcohol consumption. Early diagnosis improves treatment outcomes.
symptoms: Lump in the neck or throat
diseases.recoveryTime: Varies by stage; requires ongoing management and follow-ups
diseases.costEstimate: $1500-$4000 per month depending on treatment type and stage

diseases.description: Gastritis is the inflammation of the stomach lining, which can cause discomfort and a range of symptoms. Effective management often involves dietary and lifestyle changes.
treatment: Avoiding irritants like alcohol and NSAIDs
preventionTips: Limit the use of pain relievers
diseases.recoveryTime: Varies; often improves with lifestyle changes and medication
diseases.costEstimate: $50-$150 per month for treatment and management

diseases.description: GERD is a chronic digestive condition where stomach acid frequently flows back into the esophagus, causing irritation and discomfort.
preventionTips: Avoid triggers like spicy and fatty foods
diseases.recoveryTime: Varies; often improves with lifestyle changes and medication
diseases.costEstimate: $100-$250 per month for medication and management

diseases.description: Dengue is a viral infection transmitted by mosquitoes, causing high fever, severe headache, pain behind the eyes, joint and muscle pain, and rash.
treatment: Avoid NSAIDs like ibuprofen or aspirin
preventionTips: Eliminate standing water around living areas
diseases.recoveryTime: Usually 1-2 weeks
diseases.costEstimate: Varies depending on the severity of the case and local healthcare costs

diseases.description: Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD) is a progressive lung disease characterized by persistent airflow limitation, causing difficulty breathing, chronic cough, and mucus production. It is commonly caused by long-term exposure to harmful substances like tobacco smoke.
preventionTips: Avoid exposure to pollutants and dust
Get vaccinated for influenza and pneumonia
diseases.recoveryTime: Management of symptoms is ongoing; not curable but manageable with treatment
diseases.costEstimate: Varies depending on treatment and local healthcare costs

diseases.description: Hepatitis is an inflammation of the liver, often caused by viral infections (A, B, C, D, E), leading to symptoms like jaundice, fatigue, and abdominal pain.
symptoms: Jaundice (yellowing of the skin and eyes)
treatment: Depends on the type (A, B, C, etc.)
preventionTips: Avoid sharing needles or personal items
diseases.recoveryTime: Varies based on type and severity
diseases.costEstimate: Varies significantly depending on treatment type and location

diseases.description: Hepatitis is an inflammation of the liver, often caused by viral infections (A, B, C, D, E), leading to symptoms like jaundice, fatigue, and abdominal pain.
diseases.recoveryTime: Chronic Hepatitis B requires long-term management
diseases.costEstimate: INR 1,000 - INR 5,000 per month (for medication)

diseases.description: Hepatitis is an inflammation of the liver, often caused by viral infections (A, B, C, D, E), leading to symptoms like jaundice, fatigue, and abdominal pain.
diseases.recoveryTime: 8-12 weeks for most treatments
diseases.costEstimate: INR 50,000 - INR 200,000 for full treatment course

diseases.description: Hepatitis is an inflammation of the liver, often caused by viral infections (A, B, C, D, E), leading to symptoms like jaundice, fatigue, and abdominal pain.
symptoms: Urgency to have a bowel movement
treatment: Antidiarrheal medications (e.g., loperamide) for certain cases
Avoiding dairy products and high-fat foods
preventionTips: Avoid consuming contaminated food and water
diseases.recoveryTime: Usually resolves within a few days with proper hydration and treatment
diseases.costEstimate: $10-$50 for over-the-counter medications and rehydration solutions

diseases.description: Typhoid is a bacterial infection caused by Salmonella typhi, leading to prolonged fever, weakness, abdominal pain, and digestive issues. It spreads through contaminated food and water.
diseases.recoveryTime: Typically 1-4 weeks with appropriate antibiotic treatment
diseases.costEstimate: $100-$200 for treatment and diagnostic tests

diseases.description: Cardiovascular diseases encompass a range of conditions affecting the heart and blood vessels, including coronary artery disease, heart failure, and arrhythmias. These conditions can impair blood flow and lead to severe complications.
diseases.recoveryTime: Varies; ongoing management and lifestyle changes often required
diseases.costEstimate: Varies; can include costs for medications, medical consultations, and possibly surgical procedures

diseases.description: Piles, or hemorrhoids, are swollen veins in the lower part of the rectum and anus. They can cause discomfort, itching, and bleeding. They are common and can be caused by various factors including constipation, straining during bowel movements, and pregnancy.
treatment: Medical procedures (e.g., rubber band ligation, hemorrhoidectomy)
diseases.recoveryTime: Varies; symptoms often improve within a few days to weeks with appropriate treatment
diseases.costEstimate: Varies; costs may include medications, medical consultations, and potentially surgical procedures

diseases.description: An anal fissure is a small tear in the thin, moist tissue that lines the anus.
treatment: Medical procedures (e.g., rubber band ligation, hemorrhoidectomy)
diseases.recoveryTime: Varies; symptoms often improve within a few days to weeks with appropriate treatment
diseases.costEstimate: Varies; costs may include medications, medical consultations, and potentially surgical procedures
